Bible.Verse: 13 And say ye to Amasa, Art thou not of my bone, and of my flesh? God do so to me, and more also, if thou be not captain of the host before me continually in the room of Joab.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 14 And he bowed the heart of all the men of Judah, even as the heart of one man; so that they sent this word unto the king, Return thou, and all thy servants.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 15 So the king returned, and came to Jordan. And Judah came to Gilgal, to go to meet the king, to conduct the king over Jordan.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 16 And Shimei the son of Gera, a Benjamite, which was of Bahurim, hasted and came down with the men of Judah to meet king David.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 17 And there were a thousand men of Benjamin with him, and Ziba the servant of the house of Saul, and his fifteen sons and his twenty servants with him; and they went over Jordan before the king.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 18 And there went over a ferry boat to carry over the king's household, and to do what he thought good. And Shimei the son of Gera fell down before the king, as he was come over Jordan;

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 19 And said unto the king, Let not my lord impute iniquity unto me, neither do thou remember that which thy servant did perversely the day that my lord the king went out of Jerusalem, that the king should take it to his heart.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 20 For thy servant doth know that I have sinned: therefore, behold, I am come the first this day of all the house of Joseph to go down to meet my lord the king.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 21 But Abishai the son of Zeruiah answered and said, Shall not Shimei be put to death for this, because he cursed the LORD's anointed?

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 22 And David said, What have I to do with you, ye sons of Zeruiah, that ye should this day be adversaries unto me? shall there any man be put to death this day in Israel? for do not I know that I am this day king over Israel?

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 23 Therefore the king said unto Shimei, Thou shalt not die. And the king sware unto him.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 24 And Mephibosheth the son of Saul came down to meet the king, and had neither dressed his feet, nor trimmed his beard, nor washed his clothes, from the day the king departed until the day he came again in peace.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 25 And it came to pass, when he was come to Jerusalem to meet the king, that the king said unto him, Wherefore wentest not thou with me, Mephibosheth?

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 26 And he answered, My lord, O king, my servant deceived me: for thy servant said, I will saddle me an ass, that I may ride thereon, and go to the king; because thy servant is lame.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 27 And he hath slandered thy servant unto my lord the king; but my lord the king is as an angel of God: do therefore what is good in thine eyes.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 28 For all of my father's house were but dead men before my lord the king: yet didst thou set thy servant among them that did eat at thine own table. What right therefore have I yet to cry any more unto the king?

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 29 And the king said unto him, Why speakest thou any more of thy matters? I have said, Thou and Ziba divide the land.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 30 And Mephibosheth said unto the king, Yea, let him take all, forasmuch as my lord the king is come again in peace unto his own house.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 31 And Barzillai the Gileadite came down from Rogelim, and went over Jordan with the king, to conduct him over Jordan.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 32 Now Barzillai was a very aged man, even fourscore years old: and he had provided the king of sustenance while he lay at Mahanaim; for he was a very great man.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 33 And the king said unto Barzillai, Come thou over with me, and I will feed thee with me in Jerusalem.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 34 And Barzillai said unto the king, How long have I to live, that I should go up with the king unto Jerusalem?

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 35 I am this day fourscore years old: and can I discern between good and evil? can thy servant taste what I eat or what I drink? can I hear any more the voice of singing men and singing women? wherefore then should thy servant be yet a burden unto my lord the king?

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 36 Thy servant will go a little way over Jordan with the king: and why should the king recompense it me with such a reward?

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 37 Let thy servant, I pray thee, turn back again, that I may die in mine own city, and be buried by the grave of my father and of my mother. But behold thy servant Chimham; let him go over with my lord the king; and do to him what shall seem good unto thee.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 38 And the king answered, Chimham shall go over with me, and I will do to him that which shall seem good unto thee: and whatsoever thou shalt require of me, that will I do for thee.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 39 And all the people went over Jordan. And when the king was come over, the king kissed Barzillai, and blessed him; and he returned unto his own place.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 40 Then the king went on to Gilgal, and Chimham went on with him: and all the people of Judah conducted the king, and also half the people of Israel.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 41 And, behold, all the men of Israel came to the king, and said unto the king, Why have our brethren the men of Judah stolen thee away, and have brought the king, and his household, and all David's men with him, over Jordan?

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 42 And all the men of Judah answered the men of Israel, Because the king is near of kin to us: wherefore then be ye angry for this matter? have we eaten at all of the king's cost? or hath he given us any gift?

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 19:
Bible.Verse: 43 And the men of Israel answered the men of Judah, and said, We have ten parts in the king, and we have also more right in David than ye: why then did ye despise us, that our advice should not be first had in bringing back our king? And the words of the men of Judah were fiercer than the words of the men of Israel.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 1 And there happened to be there a man of Belial, whose name was Sheba, the son of Bichri, a Benjamite: and he blew a trumpet, and said, We have no part in David, neither have we inheritance in the son of Jesse: every man to his tents, O Israel.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 2 So every man of Israel went up from after David, and followed Sheba the son of Bichri: but the men of Judah clave unto their king, from Jordan even to Jerusalem.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 3 And David came to his house at Jerusalem; and the king took the ten women his concubines, whom he had left to keep the house, and put them in ward, and fed them, but went not in unto them. So they were shut up unto the day of their death, living in widowhood.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 4 Then said the king to Amasa, Assemble me the men of Judah within three days, and be thou here present.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 5 So Amasa went to assemble the men of Judah: but he tarried longer than the set time which he had appointed him.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 6 And David said to Abishai, Now shall Sheba the son of Bichri do us more harm than did Absalom: take thou thy lord's servants, and pursue after him, lest he get him fenced cities, and escape us.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 7 And there went out after him Joab's men, and the Cherethites, and the Pelethites, and all the mighty men: and they went out of Jerusalem, to pursue after Sheba the son of Bichri.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 8 When they were at the great stone which is in Gibeon, Amasa went before them. And Joab's garment that he had put on was girded unto him, and upon it a girdle with a sword fastened upon his loins in the sheath thereof; and as he went forth it fell out.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 9 And Joab said to Amasa, Art thou in health, my brother? And Joab took Amasa by the beard with the right hand to kiss him.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 10 But Amasa took no heed to the sword that was in Joab's hand: so he smote him therewith in the fifth rib, and shed out his bowels to the ground, and struck him not again; and he died. So Joab and Abishai his brother pursued after Sheba the son of Bichri.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 11 And one of Joab's men stood by him, and said, He that favoureth Joab, and he that is for David, let him go after Joab.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 12 And Amasa wallowed in blood in the midst of the highway. And when the man saw that all the people stood still, he removed Amasa out of the highway into the field, and cast a cloth upon him, when he saw that every one that came by him stood still.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 13 When he was removed out of the highway, all the people went on after Joab, to pursue after Sheba the son of Bichri.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 14 And he went through all the tribes of Israel unto Abel, and to Bethmaachah, and all the Berites: and they were gathered together, and went also after him.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 15 And they came and besieged him in Abel of Bethmaachah, and they cast up a bank against the city, and it stood in the trench: and all the people that were with Joab battered the wall, to throw it down.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 16 Then cried a wise woman out of the city, Hear, hear; say, I pray you, unto Joab, Come near hither, that I may speak with thee.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 17 And when he was come near unto her, the woman said, Art thou Joab? And he answered, I am he. Then she said unto him, Hear the words of thine handmaid. And he answered, I do hear.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 18 Then she spake, saying, They were wont to speak in old time, saying, They shall surely ask counsel at Abel: and so they ended the matter.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 19 I am one of them that are peaceable and faithful in Israel: thou seekest to destroy a city and a mother in Israel: why wilt thou swallow up the inheritance of the LORD?

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 20 And Joab answered and said, Far be it, far be it from me, that I should swallow up or destroy.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 21 The matter is not so: but a man of mount Ephraim, Sheba the son of Bichri by name, hath lifted up his hand against the king, even against David: deliver him only, and I will depart from the city. And the woman said unto Joab, Behold, his head shall be thrown to thee over the wall.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 22 Then the woman went unto all the people in her wisdom. And they cut off the head of Sheba the son of Bichri, and cast it out to Joab. And he blew a trumpet, and they retired from the city, every man to his tent. And Joab returned to Jerusalem unto the king.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 23 Now Joab was over all the host of Israel: and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and over the Pelethites:

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 24 And Adoram was over the tribute: and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was recorder:

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 25 And Sheva was scribe: and Zadok and Abiathar were the priests:

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 20:
Bible.Verse: 26 And Ira also the Jairite was a chief ruler about David.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 21:
Bible.Verse: 1 Then there was a famine in the days of David three years, year after year; and David enquired of the LORD. And the LORD answered, It is for Saul, and for his bloody house, because he slew the Gibeonites.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 21:
Bible.Verse: 2 And the king called the Gibeonites, and said unto them; (now the Gibeonites were not of the children of Israel, but of the remnant of the Amorites; and the children of Israel had sworn unto them: and Saul sought to slay them in his zeal to the children of Israel and Judah.)

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 21:
Bible.Verse: 3 Wherefore David said unto the Gibeonites, What shall I do for you? and wherewith shall I make the atonement, that ye may bless the inheritance of the LORD?

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 21:
Bible.Verse: 4 And the Gibeonites said unto him, We will have no silver nor gold of Saul, nor of his house; neither for us shalt thou kill any man in Israel. And he said, What ye shall say, that will I do for you.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 21:
Bible.Verse: 5 And they answered the king, The man that consumed us, and that devised against us that we should be destroyed from remaining in any of the coasts of Israel,

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 21:
Bible.Verse: 6 Let seven men of his sons be delivered unto us, and we will hang them up unto the LORD in Gibeah of Saul, whom the LORD did choose. And the king said, I will give them.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 21:
Bible.Verse: 7 But the king spared Mephibosheth, the son of Jonathan the son of Saul, because of the LORD's oath that was between them, between David and Jonathan the son of Saul.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 21:
Bible.Verse: 8 But the king took the two sons of Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, whom she bare unto Saul, Armoni and Mephibosheth; and the five sons of Michal the daughter of Saul, whom she brought up for Adriel the son of Barzillai the Meholathite:

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 21:
Bible.Verse: 9 And he delivered them into the hands of the Gibeonites, and they hanged them in the hill before the LORD: and they fell all seven together, and were put to death in the days of harvest, in the first days, in the beginning of barley harvest.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 21:
Bible.Verse: 10 And Rizpah the daughter of Aiah took sackcloth, and spread it for her upon the rock, from the beginning of harvest until water dropped upon them out of heaven, and suffered neither the birds of the air to rest on them by day, nor the beasts of the field by night.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 21:
Bible.Verse: 11 And it was told David what Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, the concubine of Saul, had done.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 21:
Bible.Verse: 12 And David went and took the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son from the men of Jabeshgilead, which had stolen them from the street of Bethshan, where the Philistines had hanged them, when the Philistines had slain Saul in Gilboa:

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 21:
Bible.Verse: 13 And he brought up from thence the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son; and they gathered the bones of them that were hanged.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 21:
Bible.Verse: 14 And the bones of Saul and Jonathan his son buried they in the country of Benjamin in Zelah, in the sepulchre of Kish his father: and they performed all that the king commanded. And after that God was intreated for the land.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 21:
Bible.Verse: 15 Moreover the Philistines had yet war again with Israel; and David went down, and his servants with him, and fought against the Philistines: and David waxed faint.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 21:
Bible.Verse: 16 And Ishbibenob, which was of the sons of the giant, the weight of whose spear weighed three hundred shekels of brass in weight, he being girded with a new sword, thought to have slain David.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 21:
Bible.Verse: 17 But Abishai the son of Zeruiah succoured him, and smote the Philistine, and killed him. Then the men of David sware unto him, saying, Thou shalt go no more out with us to battle, that thou quench not the light of Israel.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 21:
Bible.Verse: 18 And it came to pass after this, that there was again a battle with the Philistines at Gob: then Sibbechai the Hushathite slew Saph, which was of the sons of the giant.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 21:
Bible.Verse: 19 And there was again a battle in Gob with the Philistines, where Elhanan the son of Jaareoregim, a Bethlehemite, slew the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver's beam.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 21:
Bible.Verse: 20 And there was yet a battle in Gath, where was a man of great stature, that had on every hand six fingers, and on every foot six toes, four and twenty in number; and he also was born to the giant.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 21:
Bible.Verse: 21 And when he defied Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimeah the brother of David slew him.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 21:
Bible.Verse: 22 These four were born to the giant in Gath, and fell by the hand of David, and by the hand of his servants.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 1 And David spake unto the LORD the words of this song in the day that the LORD had delivered him out of the hand of all his enemies, and out of the hand of Saul:

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 2 And he said, The LORD is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer;

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 3 The God of my rock; in him will I trust: he is my shield, and the horn of my salvation, my high tower, and my refuge, my saviour; thou savest me from violence.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 4 I will call on the LORD, who is worthy to be praised: so shall I be saved from mine enemies.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 5 When the waves of death compassed me, the floods of ungodly men made me afraid;

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 6 The sorrows of hell compassed me about; the snares of death prevented me;

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 7 In my distress I called upon the LORD, and cried to my God: and he did hear my voice out of his temple, and my cry did enter into his ears.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 8 Then the earth shook and trembled; the foundations of heaven moved and shook, because he was wroth.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 9 There went up a smoke out of his nostrils, and fire out of his mouth devoured: coals were kindled by it.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 10 He bowed the heavens also, and came down; and darkness was under his feet.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 11 And he rode upon a cherub, and did fly: and he was seen upon the wings of the wind.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 12 And he made darkness pavilions round about him, dark waters, and thick clouds of the skies.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 13 Through the brightness before him were coals of fire kindled.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 14 The LORD thundered from heaven, and the most High uttered his voice.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 15 And he sent out arrows, and scattered them; lightning, and discomfited them.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 16 And the channels of the sea appeared, the foundations of the world were discovered, at the rebuking of the LORD, at the blast of the breath of his nostrils.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 17 He sent from above, he took me; he drew me out of many waters;

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 18 He delivered me from my strong enemy, and from them that hated me: for they were too strong for me.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 19 They prevented me in the day of my calamity: but the LORD was my stay.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 20 He brought me forth also into a large place: he delivered me, because he delighted in me.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 21 The LORD rewarded me according to my righteousness: according to the cleanness of my hands hath he recompensed me.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 22 For I have kept the ways of the LORD, and have not wickedly departed from my God.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 23 For all his judgments were before me: and as for his statutes, I did not depart from them.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 24 I was also upright before him, and have kept myself from mine iniquity.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 25 Therefore the LORD hath recompensed me according to my righteousness; according to my cleanness in his eye sight.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 26 With the merciful thou wilt shew thyself merciful, and with the upright man thou wilt shew thyself upright.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 27 With the pure thou wilt shew thyself pure; and with the froward thou wilt shew thyself unsavoury.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 28 And the afflicted people thou wilt save: but thine eyes are upon the haughty, that thou mayest bring them down.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 29 For thou art my lamp, O LORD: and the LORD will lighten my darkness.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 30 For by thee I have run through a troop: by my God have I leaped over a wall.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 31 As for God, his way is perfect; the word of the LORD is tried: he is a buckler to all them that trust in him.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 32 For who is God, save the LORD? and who is a rock, save our God?

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 33 God is my strength and power: and he maketh my way perfect.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 34 He maketh my feet like hinds' feet: and setteth me upon my high places.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 35 He teacheth my hands to war; so that a bow of steel is broken by mine arms.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 36 Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation: and thy gentleness hath made me great.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 37 Thou hast enlarged my steps under me; so that my feet did not slip.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 38 I have pursued mine enemies, and destroyed them; and turned not again until I had consumed them.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 39 And I have consumed them, and wounded them, that they could not arise: yea, they are fallen under my feet.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 40 For thou hast girded me with strength to battle: them that rose up against me hast thou subdued under me.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 41 Thou hast also given me the necks of mine enemies, that I might destroy them that hate me.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 42 They looked, but there was none to save; even unto the LORD, but he answered them not.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 43 Then did I beat them as small as the dust of the earth, I did stamp them as the mire of the street, and did spread them abroad.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 44 Thou also hast delivered me from the strivings of my people, thou hast kept me to be head of the heathen: a people which I knew not shall serve me.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 45 Strangers shall submit themselves unto me: as soon as they hear, they shall be obedient unto me.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 46 Strangers shall fade away, and they shall be afraid out of their close places.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 47 The LORD liveth; and blessed be my rock; and exalted be the God of the rock of my salvation.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 48 It is God that avengeth me, and that bringeth down the people under me,

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 49 And that bringeth me forth from mine enemies: thou also hast lifted me up on high above them that rose up against me: thou hast delivered me from the violent man.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 50 Therefore I will give thanks unto thee, O LORD, among the heathen, and I will sing praises unto thy name.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 22:
Bible.Verse: 51 He is the tower of salvation for his king: and sheweth mercy to his anointed, unto David, and to his seed for evermore.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 1 Now these be the last words of David. David the son of Jesse said, and the man who was raised up on high, the anointed of the God of Jacob, and the sweet psalmist of Israel, said,

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 2 The Spirit of the LORD spake by me, and his word was in my tongue.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 3 The God of Israel said, the Rock of Israel spake to me, He that ruleth over men must be just, ruling in the fear of God.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 4 And he shall be as the light of the morning, when the sun riseth, even a morning without clouds; as the tender grass springing out of the earth by clear shining after rain.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 5 Although my house be not so with God; yet he hath made with me an everlasting covenant, ordered in all things, and sure: for this is all my salvation, and all my desire, although he make it not to grow.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 6 But the sons of Belial shall be all of them as thorns thrust away, because they cannot be taken with hands:

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 7 But the man that shall touch them must be fenced with iron and the staff of a spear; and they shall be utterly burned with fire in the same place.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 8 These be the names of the mighty men whom David had: The Tachmonite that sat in the seat, chief among the captains; the same was Adino the Eznite: he lift up his spear against eight hundred, whom he slew at one time.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 9 And after him was Eleazar the son of Dodo the Ahohite, one of the three mighty men with David, when they defied the Philistines that were there gathered together to battle, and the men of Israel were gone away:

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 10 He arose, and smote the Philistines until his hand was weary, and his hand clave unto the sword: and the LORD wrought a great victory that day; and the people returned after him only to spoil.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 11 And after him was Shammah the son of Agee the Hararite. And the Philistines were gathered together into a troop, where was a piece of ground full of lentiles: and the people fled from the Philistines.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 12 But he stood in the midst of the ground, and defended it, and slew the Philistines: and the LORD wrought a great victory.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 13 And three of the thirty chief went down, and came to David in the harvest time unto the cave of Adullam: and the troop of the Philistines pitched in the valley of Rephaim.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 14 And David was then in an hold, and the garrison of the Philistines was then in Bethlehem.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 15 And David longed, and said, Oh that one would give me drink of the water of the well of Bethlehem, which is by the gate!

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 16 And the three mighty men brake through the host of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Bethlehem, that was by the gate, and took it, and brought it to David: nevertheless he would not drink thereof, but poured it out unto the LORD.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 17 And he said, Be it far from me, O LORD, that I should do this: is not this the blood of the men that went in jeopardy of their lives? therefore he would not drink it. These things did these three mighty men.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 18 And Abishai, the brother of Joab, the son of Zeruiah, was chief among three. And he lifted up his spear against three hundred, and slew them, and had the name among three.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 19 Was he not most honourable of three? therefore he was their captain: howbeit he attained not unto the first three.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 20 And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man, of Kabzeel, who had done many acts, he slew two lionlike men of Moab: he went down also and slew a lion in the midst of a pit in time of snow:

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 21 And he slew an Egyptian, a goodly man: and the Egyptian had a spear in his hand; but he went down to him with a staff, and plucked the spear out of the Egyptian's hand, and slew him with his own spear.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 22 These things did Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and had the name among three mighty men.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 23 He was more honourable than the thirty, but he attained not to the first three. And David set him over his guard.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 24 Asahel the brother of Joab was one of the thirty; Elhanan the son of Dodo of Bethlehem,

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 25 Shammah the Harodite, Elika the Harodite,

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 26 Helez the Paltite, Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite,

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 27 Abiezer the Anethothite, Mebunnai the Hushathite,

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 28 Zalmon the Ahohite, Maharai the Netophathite,

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 29 Heleb the son of Baanah, a Netophathite, Ittai the son of Ribai out of Gibeah of the children of Benjamin,

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 30 Benaiah the Pirathonite, Hiddai of the brooks of Gaash,

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 31 Abialbon the Arbathite, Azmaveth the Barhumite,

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 32 Eliahba the Shaalbonite, of the sons of Jashen, Jonathan,

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 33 Shammah the Hararite, Ahiam the son of Sharar the Hararite,

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 34 Eliphelet the son of Ahasbai, the son of the Maachathite, Eliam the son of Ahithophel the Gilonite,

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 35 Hezrai the Carmelite, Paarai the Arbite,

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 36 Igal the son of Nathan of Zobah, Bani the Gadite,

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 37 Zelek the Ammonite, Nahari the Beerothite, armourbearer to Joab the son of Zeruiah,

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 38 Ira an Ithrite, Gareb an Ithrite,

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 23:
Bible.Verse: 39 Uriah the Hittite: thirty and seven in all.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 1 And again the anger of the LORD was kindled against Israel, and he moved David against them to say, Go, number Israel and Judah.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 2 For the king said to Joab the captain of the host, which was with him, Go now through all the tribes of Israel, from Dan even to Beersheba, and number ye the people, that I may know the number of the people.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 3 And Joab said unto the king, Now the LORD thy God add unto the people, how many soever they be, an hundredfold, and that the eyes of my lord the king may see it: but why doth my lord the king delight in this thing?

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 4 Notwithstanding the king's word prevailed against Joab, and against the captains of the host. And Joab and the captains of the host went out from the presence of the king, to number the people of Israel.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 5 And they passed over Jordan, and pitched in Aroer, on the right side of the city that lieth in the midst of the river of Gad, and toward Jazer:

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 6 Then they came to Gilead, and to the land of Tahtimhodshi; and they came to Danjaan, and about to Zidon,

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 7 And came to the strong hold of Tyre, and to all the cities of the Hivites, and of the Canaanites: and they went out to the south of Judah, even to Beersheba.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 8 So when they had gone through all the land, they came to Jerusalem at the end of nine months and twenty days.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 9 And Joab gave up the sum of the number of the people unto the king: and there were in Israel eight hundred thousand valiant men that drew the sword; and the men of Judah were five hundred thousand men.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 10 And David's heart smote him after that he had numbered the people. And David said unto the LORD, I have sinned greatly in that I have done: and now, I beseech thee, O LORD, take away the iniquity of thy servant; for I have done very foolishly.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 11 For when David was up in the morning, the word of the LORD came unto the prophet Gad, David's seer, saying,

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 12 Go and say unto David, Thus saith the LORD, I offer thee three things; choose thee one of them, that I may do it unto thee.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 13 So Gad came to David, and told him, and said unto him, Shall seven years of famine come unto thee in thy land? or wilt thou flee three months before thine enemies, while they pursue thee? or that there be three days' pestilence in thy land? now advise, and see what answer I shall return to him that sent me.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 14 And David said unto Gad, I am in a great strait: let us fall now into the hand of the LORD; for his mercies are great: and let me not fall into the hand of man.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 15 So the LORD sent a pestilence upon Israel from the morning even to the time appointed: and there died of the people from Dan even to Beersheba seventy thousand men.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 16 And when the angel stretched out his hand upon Jerusalem to destroy it, the LORD repented him of the evil, and said to the angel that destroyed the people, It is enough: stay now thine hand. And the angel of the LORD was by the threshingplace of Araunah the Jebusite.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 17 And David spake unto the LORD when he saw the angel that smote the people, and said, Lo, I have sinned, and I have done wickedly: but these sheep, what have they done? let thine hand, I pray thee, be against me, and against my father's house.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 18 And Gad came that day to David, and said unto him, Go up, rear an altar unto the LORD in the threshingfloor of Araunah the Jebusite.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 19 And David, according to the saying of Gad, went up as the LORD commanded.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 20 And Araunah looked, and saw the king and his servants coming on toward him: and Araunah went out, and bowed himself before the king on his face upon the ground.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 21 And Araunah said, Wherefore is my lord the king come to his servant? And David said, To buy the threshingfloor of thee, to build an altar unto the LORD, that the plague may be stayed from the people.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 22 And Araunah said unto David, Let my lord the king take and offer up what seemeth good unto him: behold, here be oxen for burnt sacrifice, and threshing instruments and other instruments of the oxen for wood.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 23 All these things did Araunah, as a king, give unto the king. And Araunah said unto the king, The LORD thy God accept thee.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 24 And the king said unto Araunah, Nay; but I will surely buy it of thee at a price: neither will I offer burnt offerings unto the LORD my God of that which doth cost me nothing. So David bought the threshingfloor and the oxen for fifty shekels of silver.

Bible.Title: 2 Samuel 24:
Bible.Verse: 25 And David built there an altar unto the LORD, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings. So the LORD was intreated for the land, and the plague was stayed from Israel.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 1 Now king David was old and stricken in years; and they covered him with clothes, but he gat no heat.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 2 Wherefore his servants said unto him, Let there be sought for my lord the king a young virgin: and let her stand before the king, and let her cherish him, and let her lie in thy bosom, that my lord the king may get heat.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 3 So they sought for a fair damsel throughout all the coasts of Israel, and found Abishag a Shunammite, and brought her to the king.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 4 And the damsel was very fair, and cherished the king, and ministered to him: but the king knew her not.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 5 Then Adonijah the son of Haggith exalted himself, saying, I will be king: and he prepared him chariots and horsemen, and fifty men to run before him.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 6 And his father had not displeased him at any time in saying, Why hast thou done so? and he also was a very goodly man; and his mother bare him after Absalom.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 7 And he conferred with Joab the son of Zeruiah, and with Abiathar the priest: and they following Adonijah helped him.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 8 But Zadok the priest, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and Nathan the prophet, and Shimei, and Rei, and the mighty men which belonged to David, were not with Adonijah.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 9 And Adonijah slew sheep and oxen and fat cattle by the stone of Zoheleth, which is by Enrogel, and called all his brethren the king's sons, and all the men of Judah the king's servants:

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 10 But Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah, and the mighty men, and Solomon his brother, he called not.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 11 Wherefore Nathan spake unto Bathsheba the mother of Solomon, saying, Hast thou not heard that Adonijah the son of Haggith doth reign, and David our lord knoweth it not?

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 12 Now therefore come, let me, I pray thee, give thee counsel, that thou mayest save thine own life, and the life of thy son Solomon.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 13 Go and get thee in unto king David, and say unto him, Didst not thou, my lord, O king, swear unto thine handmaid, saying, Assuredly Solomon thy son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne? why then doth Adonijah reign?

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 14 Behold, while thou yet talkest there with the king, I also will come in after thee, and confirm thy words.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 15 And Bathsheba went in unto the king into the chamber: and the king was very old; and Abishag the Shunammite ministered unto the king.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 16 And Bathsheba bowed, and did obeisance unto the king. And the king said, What wouldest thou?

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 17 And she said unto him, My lord, thou swarest by the LORD thy God unto thine handmaid, saying, Assuredly Solomon thy son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 18 And now, behold, Adonijah reigneth; and now, my lord the king, thou knowest it not:

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 19 And he hath slain oxen and fat cattle and sheep in abundance, and hath called all the sons of the king, and Abiathar the priest, and Joab the captain of the host: but Solomon thy servant hath he not called.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 20 And thou, my lord, O king, the eyes of all Israel are upon thee, that thou shouldest tell them who shall sit on the throne of my lord the king after him.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 21 Otherwise it shall come to pass, when my lord the king shall sleep with his fathers, that I and my son Solomon shall be counted offenders.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 22 And, lo, while she yet talked with the king, Nathan the prophet also came in.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 23 And they told the king, saying, Behold Nathan the prophet. And when he was come in before the king, he bowed himself before the king with his face to the ground.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 24 And Nathan said, My lord, O king, hast thou said, Adonijah shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne?

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 25 For he is gone down this day, and hath slain oxen and fat cattle and sheep in abundance, and hath called all the king's sons, and the captains of the host, and Abiathar the priest; and, behold, they eat and drink before him, and say, God save king Adonijah.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 26 But me, even me thy servant, and Zadok the priest, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and thy servant Solomon, hath he not called.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 27 Is this thing done by my lord the king, and thou hast not shewed it unto thy servant, who should sit on the throne of my lord the king after him?

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 28 Then king David answered and said, Call me Bathsheba. And she came into the king's presence, and stood before the king.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 29 And the king sware, and said, As the LORD liveth, that hath redeemed my soul out of all distress,

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 30 Even as I sware unto thee by the LORD God of Israel, saying, Assuredly Solomon thy son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne in my stead; even so will I certainly do this day.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 31 Then Bathsheba bowed with her face to the earth, and did reverence to the king, and said, Let my lord king David live for ever.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 32 And king David said, Call me Zadok the priest, and Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada. And they came before the king.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 33 The king also said unto them, Take with you the servants of your lord, and cause Solomon my son to ride upon mine own mule, and bring him down to Gihon:

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 34 And let Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet anoint him there king over Israel: and blow ye with the trumpet, and say, God save king Solomon.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 35 Then ye shall come up after him, that he may come and sit upon my throne; for he shall be king in my stead: and I have appointed him to be ruler over Israel and over Judah.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 36 And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada answered the king, and said, Amen: the LORD God of my lord the king say so too.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 37 As the LORD hath been with my lord the king, even so be he with Solomon, and make his throne greater than the throne of my lord king David.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 38 So Zadok the priest, and Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites, and the Pelethites, went down, and caused Solomon to ride upon king David's mule, and brought him to Gihon.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 39 And Zadok the priest took an horn of oil out of the tabernacle, and anointed Solomon. And they blew the trumpet; and all the people said, God save king Solomon.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 40 And all the people came up after him, and the people piped with pipes, and rejoiced with great joy, so that the earth rent with the sound of them.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 41 And Adonijah and all the guests that were with him heard it as they had made an end of eating. And when Joab heard the sound of the trumpet, he said, Wherefore is this noise of the city being in an uproar?

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 42 And while he yet spake, behold, Jonathan the son of Abiathar the priest came; and Adonijah said unto him, Come in; for thou art a valiant man, and bringest good tidings.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 43 And Jonathan answered and said to Adonijah, Verily our lord king David hath made Solomon king.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 44 And the king hath sent with him Zadok the priest, and Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites, and the Pelethites, and they have caused him to ride upon the king's mule:

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 45 And Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet have anointed him king in Gihon: and they are come up from thence rejoicing, so that the city rang again. This is the noise that ye have heard.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 46 And also Solomon sitteth on the throne of the kingdom.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 47 And moreover the king's servants came to bless our lord king David, saying, God make the name of Solomon better than thy name, and make his throne greater than thy throne. And the king bowed himself upon the bed.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 48 And also thus said the king, Blessed be the LORD God of Israel, which hath given one to sit on my throne this day, mine eyes even seeing it.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 49 And all the guests that were with Adonijah were afraid, and rose up, and went every man his way.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 50 And Adonijah feared because of Solomon, and arose, and went, and caught hold on the horns of the altar.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 51 And it was told Solomon, saying, Behold, Adonijah feareth king Solomon: for, lo, he hath caught hold on the horns of the altar, saying, Let king Solomon swear unto me today that he will not slay his servant with the sword.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 52 And Solomon said, If he will shew himself a worthy man, there shall not an hair of him fall to the earth: but if wickedness shall be found in him, he shall die.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 1:
Bible.Verse: 53 So king Solomon sent, and they brought him down from the altar. And he came and bowed himself to king Solomon: and Solomon said unto him, Go to thine house.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 1 Now the days of David drew nigh that he should die; and he charged Solomon his son, saying,

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 2 I go the way of all the earth: be thou strong therefore, and shew thyself a man;

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 3 And keep the charge of the LORD thy God, to walk in his ways, to keep his statutes, and his commandments, and his judgments, and his testimonies, as it is written in the law of Moses, that thou mayest prosper in all that thou doest, and whithersoever thou turnest thyself:

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 4 That the LORD may continue his word which he spake concerning me, saying, If thy children take heed to their way, to walk before me in truth with all their heart and with all their soul, there shall not fail thee (said he) a man on the throne of Israel.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 5 Moreover thou knowest also what Joab the son of Zeruiah did to me, and what he did to the two captains of the hosts of Israel, unto Abner the son of Ner, and unto Amasa the son of Jether, whom he slew, and shed the blood of war in peace, and put the blood of war upon his girdle that was about his loins, and in his shoes that were on his feet.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 6 Do therefore according to thy wisdom, and let not his hoar head go down to the grave in peace.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 7 But shew kindness unto the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite, and let them be of those that eat at thy table: for so they came to me when I fled because of Absalom thy brother.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 8 And, behold, thou hast with thee Shimei the son of Gera, a Benjamite of Bahurim, which cursed me with a grievous curse in the day when I went to Mahanaim: but he came down to meet me at Jordan, and I sware to him by the LORD, saying, I will not put thee to death with the sword.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 9 Now therefore hold him not guiltless: for thou art a wise man, and knowest what thou oughtest to do unto him; but his hoar head bring thou down to the grave with blood.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 10 So David slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 11 And the days that David reigned over Israel were forty years: seven years reigned he in Hebron, and thirty and three years reigned he in Jerusalem.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 12 Then sat Solomon upon the throne of David his father; and his kingdom was established greatly.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 13 And Adonijah the son of Haggith came to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon. And she said, Comest thou peaceably? And he said, Peaceably.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 14 He said moreover, I have somewhat to say unto thee. And she said, Say on.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 15 And he said, Thou knowest that the kingdom was mine, and that all Israel set their faces on me, that I should reign: howbeit the kingdom is turned about, and is become my brother's: for it was his from the LORD.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 16 And now I ask one petition of thee, deny me not. And she said unto him, Say on.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 17 And he said, Speak, I pray thee, unto Solomon the king, (for he will not say thee nay,) that he give me Abishag the Shunammite to wife.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 18 And Bathsheba said, Well; I will speak for thee unto the king.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 19 Bathsheba therefore went unto king Solomon, to speak unto him for Adonijah. And the king rose up to meet her, and bowed himself unto her, and sat down on his throne, and caused a seat to be set for the king's mother; and she sat on his right hand.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 20 Then she said, I desire one small petition of thee; I pray thee, say me not nay. And the king said unto her, Ask on, my mother: for I will not say thee nay.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 21 And she said, Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to Adonijah thy brother to wife.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 22 And king Solomon answered and said unto his mother, And why dost thou ask Abishag the Shunammite for Adonijah? ask for him the kingdom also; for he is mine elder brother; even for him, and for Abiathar the priest, and for Joab the son of Zeruiah.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 23 Then king Solomon sware by the LORD, saying, God do so to me, and more also, if Adonijah have not spoken this word against his own life.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 24 Now therefore, as the LORD liveth, which hath established me, and set me on the throne of David my father, and who hath made me an house, as he promised, Adonijah shall be put to death this day.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 25 And king Solomon sent by the hand of Benaiah the son of Jehoiada; and he fell upon him that he died.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 26 And unto Abiathar the priest said the king, Get thee to Anathoth, unto thine own fields; for thou art worthy of death: but I will not at this time put thee to death, because thou barest the ark of the LORD God before David my father, and because thou hast been afflicted in all wherein my father was afflicted.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 27 So Solomon thrust out Abiathar from being priest unto the LORD; that he might fulfil the word of the LORD, which he spake concerning the house of Eli in Shiloh.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 28 Then tidings came to Joab: for Joab had turned after Adonijah, though he turned not after Absalom. And Joab fled unto the tabernacle of the LORD, and caught hold on the horns of the altar.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 29 And it was told king Solomon that Joab was fled unto the tabernacle of the LORD; and, behold, he is by the altar. Then Solomon sent Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, saying, Go, fall upon him.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 30 And Benaiah came to the tabernacle of the LORD, and said unto him, Thus saith the king, Come forth. And he said, Nay; but I will die here. And Benaiah brought the king word again, saying, Thus said Joab, and thus he answered me.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 31 And the king said unto him, Do as he hath said, and fall upon him, and bury him; that thou mayest take away the innocent blood, which Joab shed, from me, and from the house of my father.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 32 And the LORD shall return his blood upon his own head, who fell upon two men more righteous and better than he, and slew them with the sword, my father David not knowing thereof, to wit, Abner the son of Ner, captain of the host of Israel, and Amasa the son of Jether, captain of the host of Judah.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 33 Their blood shall therefore return upon the head of Joab, and upon the head of his seed for ever: but upon David, and upon his seed, and upon his house, and upon his throne, shall there be peace for ever from the LORD.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 34 So Benaiah the son of Jehoiada went up, and fell upon him, and slew him: and he was buried in his own house in the wilderness.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 35 And the king put Benaiah the son of Jehoiada in his room over the host: and Zadok the priest did the king put in the room of Abiathar.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 36 And the king sent and called for Shimei, and said unto him, Build thee an house in Jerusalem, and dwell there, and go not forth thence any whither.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 37 For it shall be, that on the day thou goest out, and passest over the brook Kidron, thou shalt know for certain that thou shalt surely die: thy blood shall be upon thine own head.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 38 And Shimei said unto the king, The saying is good: as my lord the king hath said, so will thy servant do. And Shimei dwelt in Jerusalem many days.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 39 And it came to pass at the end of three years, that two of the servants of Shimei ran away unto Achish son of Maachah king of Gath. And they told Shimei, saying, Behold, thy servants be in Gath.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 40 And Shimei arose, and saddled his ass, and went to Gath to Achish to seek his servants: and Shimei went, and brought his servants from Gath.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 41 And it was told Solomon that Shimei had gone from Jerusalem to Gath, and was come again.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 42 And the king sent and called for Shimei, and said unto him, Did I not make thee to swear by the LORD, and protested unto thee, saying, Know for a certain, on the day thou goest out, and walkest abroad any whither, that thou shalt surely die? and thou saidst unto me, The word that I have heard is good.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 43 Why then hast thou not kept the oath of the LORD, and the commandment that I have charged thee with?

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 44 The king said moreover to Shimei, Thou knowest all the wickedness which thine heart is privy to, that thou didst to David my father: therefore the LORD shall return thy wickedness upon thine own head;

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 45 And king Solomon shall be blessed, and the throne of David shall be established before the LORD for ever.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 2:
Bible.Verse: 46 So the king commanded Benaiah the son of Jehoiada; which went out, and fell upon him, that he died. And the kingdom was established in the hand of Solomon.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 1 And Solomon made affinity with Pharaoh king of Egypt, and took Pharaoh's daughter, and brought her into the city of David, until he had made an end of building his own house, and the house of the LORD, and the wall of Jerusalem round about.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 2 Only the people sacrificed in high places, because there was no house built unto the name of the LORD, until those days.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 3 And Solomon loved the LORD, walking in the statutes of David his father: only he sacrificed and burnt incense in high places.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 4 And the king went to Gibeon to sacrifice there; for that was the great high place: a thousand burnt offerings did Solomon offer upon that altar.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 5 In Gibeon the LORD appeared to Solomon in a dream by night: and God said, Ask what I shall give thee.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 6 And Solomon said, Thou hast shewed unto thy servant David my father great mercy, according as he walked before thee in truth, and in righteousness, and in uprightness of heart with thee; and thou hast kept for him this great kindness, that thou hast given him a son to sit on his throne, as it is this day.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 7 And now, O LORD my God, thou hast made thy servant king instead of David my father: and I am but a little child: I know not how to go out or come in.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 8 And thy servant is in the midst of thy people which thou hast chosen, a great people, that cannot be numbered nor counted for multitude.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 9 Give therefore thy servant an understanding heart to judge thy people, that I may discern between good and bad: for who is able to judge this thy so great a people?

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 10 And the speech pleased the LORD, that Solomon had asked this thing.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 11 And God said unto him, Because thou hast asked this thing, and hast not asked for thyself long life; neither hast asked riches for thyself, nor hast asked the life of thine enemies; but hast asked for thyself understanding to discern judgment;

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 12 Behold, I have done according to thy words: lo, I have given thee a wise and an understanding heart; so that there was none like thee before thee, neither after thee shall any arise like unto thee.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 13 And I have also given thee that which thou hast not asked, both riches, and honour: so that there shall not be any among the kings like unto thee all thy days.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 14 And if thou wilt walk in my ways, to keep my statutes and my commandments, as thy father David did walk, then I will lengthen thy days.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 15 And Solomon awoke; and, behold, it was a dream. And he came to Jerusalem, and stood before the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and offered up burnt offerings, and offered peace offerings, and made a feast to all his servants.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 16 Then came there two women, that were harlots, unto the king, and stood before him.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 17 And the one woman said, O my lord, I and this woman dwell in one house; and I was delivered of a child with her in the house.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 18 And it came to pass the third day after that I was delivered, that this woman was delivered also: and we were together; there was no stranger with us in the house, save we two in the house.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 19 And this woman's child died in the night; because she overlaid it.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 20 And she arose at midnight, and took my son from beside me, while thine handmaid slept, and laid it in her bosom, and laid her dead child in my bosom.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 21 And when I rose in the morning to give my child suck, behold, it was dead: but when I had considered it in the morning, behold, it was not my son, which I did bear.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 22 And the other woman said, Nay; but the living is my son, and the dead is thy son. And this said, No; but the dead is thy son, and the living is my son. Thus they spake before the king.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 23 Then said the king, The one saith, This is my son that liveth, and thy son is the dead: and the other saith, Nay; but thy son is the dead, and my son is the living.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 24 And the king said, Bring me a sword. And they brought a sword before the king.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 25 And the king said, Divide the living child in two, and give half to the one, and half to the other.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 26 Then spake the woman whose the living child was unto the king, for her bowels yearned upon her son, and she said, O my lord, give her the living child, and in no wise slay it. But the other said, Let it be neither mine nor thine, but divide it.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 27 Then the king answered and said, Give her the living child, and in no wise slay it: she is the mother thereof.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 3:
Bible.Verse: 28 And all Israel heard of the judgment which the king had judged; and they feared the king: for they saw that the wisdom of God was in him, to do judgment.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 1 So king Solomon was king over all Israel.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 2 And these were the princes which he had; Azariah the son of Zadok the priest,

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 3 Elihoreph and Ahiah, the sons of Shisha, scribes; Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud, the recorder.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 4 And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the host: and Zadok and Abiathar were the priests:

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 5 And Azariah the son of Nathan was over the officers: and Zabud the son of Nathan was principal officer, and the king's friend:

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 6 And Ahishar was over the household: and Adoniram the son of Abda was over the tribute.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 7 And Solomon had twelve officers over all Israel, which provided victuals for the king and his household: each man his month in a year made provision.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 8 And these are their names: The son of Hur, in mount Ephraim:

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 9 The son of Dekar, in Makaz, and in Shaalbim, and Bethshemesh, and Elonbethhanan:

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 10 The son of Hesed, in Aruboth; to him pertained Sochoh, and all the land of Hepher:

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 11 The son of Abinadab, in all the region of Dor; which had Taphath the daughter of Solomon to wife:

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 12 Baana the son of Ahilud; to him pertained Taanach and Megiddo, and all Bethshean, which is by Zartanah beneath Jezreel, from Bethshean to Abelmeholah, even unto the place that is beyond Jokneam:

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 13 The son of Geber, in Ramothgilead; to him pertained the towns of Jair the son of Manasseh, which are in Gilead; to him also pertained the region of Argob, which is in Bashan, threescore great cities with walls and brasen bars:

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 14 Ahinadab the son of Iddo had Mahanaim:

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 15 Ahimaaz was in Naphtali; he also took Basmath the daughter of Solomon to wife:

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 16 Baanah the son of Hushai was in Asher and in Aloth:

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 17 Jehoshaphat the son of Paruah, in Issachar:

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 18 Shimei the son of Elah, in Benjamin:

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 19 Geber the son of Uri was in the country of Gilead, in the country of Sihon king of the Amorites, and of Og king of Bashan; and he was the only officer which was in the land.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 20 Judah and Israel were many, as the sand which is by the sea in multitude, eating and drinking, and making merry.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 21 And Solomon reigned over all kingdoms from the river unto the land of the Philistines, and unto the border of Egypt: they brought presents, and served Solomon all the days of his life.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 22 And Solomon's provision for one day was thirty measures of fine flour, and threescore measures of meal,

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 23 Ten fat oxen, and twenty oxen out of the pastures, and an hundred sheep, beside harts, and roebucks, and fallowdeer, and fatted fowl.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 24 For he had dominion over all the region on this side the river, from Tiphsah even to Azzah, over all the kings on this side the river: and he had peace on all sides round about him.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 25 And Judah and Israel dwelt safely, every man under his vine and under his fig tree, from Dan even to Beersheba, all the days of Solomon.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 26 And Solomon had forty thousand stalls of horses for his chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 27 And those officers provided victual for king Solomon, and for all that came unto king Solomon's table, every man in his month: they lacked nothing.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 28 Barley also and straw for the horses and dromedaries brought they unto the place where the officers were, every man according to his charge.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 29 And God gave Solomon wisdom and understanding exceeding much, and largeness of heart, even as the sand that is on the sea shore.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 30 And Solomon's wisdom excelled the wisdom of all the children of the east country, and all the wisdom of Egypt.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 31 For he was wiser than all men; than Ethan the Ezrahite, and Heman, and Chalcol, and Darda, the sons of Mahol: and his fame was in all nations round about.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 32 And he spake three thousand proverbs: and his songs were a thousand and five.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 33 And he spake of trees, from the cedar tree that is in Lebanon even unto the hyssop that springeth out of the wall: he spake also of beasts, and of fowl, and of creeping things, and of fishes.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 4:
Bible.Verse: 34 And there came of all people to hear the wisdom of Solomon, from all kings of the earth, which had heard of his wisdom.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 5:
Bible.Verse: 1 And Hiram king of Tyre sent his servants unto Solomon; for he had heard that they had anointed him king in the room of his father: for Hiram was ever a lover of David.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 5:
Bible.Verse: 2 And Solomon sent to Hiram, saying,

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 5:
Bible.Verse: 3 Thou knowest how that David my father could not build an house unto the name of the LORD his God for the wars which were about him on every side, until the LORD put them under the soles of his feet.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 5:
Bible.Verse: 4 But now the LORD my God hath given me rest on every side, so that there is neither adversary nor evil occurrent.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 5:
Bible.Verse: 5 And, behold, I purpose to build an house unto the name of the LORD my God, as the LORD spake unto David my father, saying, Thy son, whom I will set upon thy throne in thy room, he shall build an house unto my name.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 5:
Bible.Verse: 6 Now therefore command thou that they hew me cedar trees out of Lebanon; and my servants shall be with thy servants: and unto thee will I give hire for thy servants according to all that thou shalt appoint: for thou knowest that there is not among us any that can skill to hew timber like unto the Sidonians.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 5:
Bible.Verse: 7 And it came to pass, when Hiram heard the words of Solomon, that he rejoiced greatly, and said, Blessed be the LORD this day, which hath given unto David a wise son over this great people.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 5:
Bible.Verse: 8 And Hiram sent to Solomon, saying, I have considered the things which thou sentest to me for: and I will do all thy desire concerning timber of cedar, and concerning timber of fir.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 5:
Bible.Verse: 9 My servants shall bring them down from Lebanon unto the sea: and I will convey them by sea in floats unto the place that thou shalt appoint me, and will cause them to be discharged there, and thou shalt receive them: and thou shalt accomplish my desire, in giving food for my household.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 5:
Bible.Verse: 10 So Hiram gave Solomon cedar trees and fir trees according to all his desire.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 5:
Bible.Verse: 11 And Solomon gave Hiram twenty thousand measures of wheat for food to his household, and twenty measures of pure oil: thus gave Solomon to Hiram year by year.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 5:
Bible.Verse: 12 And the LORD gave Solomon wisdom, as he promised him: and there was peace between Hiram and Solomon; and they two made a league together.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 5:
Bible.Verse: 13 And king Solomon raised a levy out of all Israel; and the levy was thirty thousand men.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 5:
Bible.Verse: 14 And he sent them to Lebanon, ten thousand a month by courses: a month they were in Lebanon, and two months at home: and Adoniram was over the levy.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 5:
Bible.Verse: 15 And Solomon had threescore and ten thousand that bare burdens, and fourscore thousand hewers in the mountains;

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 5:
Bible.Verse: 16 Beside the chief of Solomon's officers which were over the work, three thousand and three hundred, which ruled over the people that wrought in the work.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 5:
Bible.Verse: 17 And the king commanded, and they brought great stones, costly stones, and hewed stones, to lay the foundation of the house.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 5:
Bible.Verse: 18 And Solomon's builders and Hiram's builders did hew them, and the stonesquarers: so they prepared timber and stones to build the house.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 1 And it came to pass in the four hundred and eightieth year after the children of Israel were come out of the land of Egypt, in the fourth year of Solomon's reign over Israel, in the month Zif, which is the second month, that he began to build the house of the LORD.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 2 And the house which king Solomon built for the LORD, the length thereof was threescore cubits, and the breadth thereof twenty cubits, and the height thereof thirty cubits.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 3 And the porch before the temple of the house, twenty cubits was the length thereof, according to the breadth of the house; and ten cubits was the breadth thereof before the house.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 4 And for the house he made windows of narrow lights.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 5 And against the wall of the house he built chambers round about, against the walls of the house round about, both of the temple and of the oracle: and he made chambers round about:

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 6 The nethermost chamber was five cubits broad, and the middle was six cubits broad, and the third was seven cubits broad: for without in the wall of the house he made narrowed rests round about, that the beams should not be fastened in the walls of the house.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 7 And the house, when it was in building, was built of stone made ready before it was brought thither: so that there was neither hammer nor axe nor any tool of iron heard in the house, while it was in building.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 8 The door for the middle chamber was in the right side of the house: and they went up with winding stairs into the middle chamber, and out of the middle into the third.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 9 So he built the house, and finished it; and covered the house with beams and boards of cedar.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 10 And then he built chambers against all the house, five cubits high: and they rested on the house with timber of cedar.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 11 And the word of the LORD came to Solomon, saying,

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 12 Concerning this house which thou art in building, if thou wilt walk in my statutes, and execute my judgments, and keep all my commandments to walk in them; then will I perform my word with thee, which I spake unto David thy father:

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 13 And I will dwell among the children of Israel, and will not forsake my people Israel.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 14 So Solomon built the house, and finished it.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 15 And he built the walls of the house within with boards of cedar, both the floor of the house, and the walls of the ceiling: and he covered them on the inside with wood, and covered the floor of the house with planks of fir.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 16 And he built twenty cubits on the sides of the house, both the floor and the walls with boards of cedar: he even built them for it within, even for the oracle, even for the most holy place.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 17 And the house, that is, the temple before it, was forty cubits long.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 18 And the cedar of the house within was carved with knops and open flowers: all was cedar; there was no stone seen.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 19 And the oracle he prepared in the house within, to set there the ark of the covenant of the LORD.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 20 And the oracle in the forepart was twenty cubits in length, and twenty cubits in breadth, and twenty cubits in the height thereof: and he overlaid it with pure gold; and so covered the altar which was of cedar.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 21 So Solomon overlaid the house within with pure gold: and he made a partition by the chains of gold before the oracle; and he overlaid it with gold.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 22 And the whole house he overlaid with gold, until he had finished all the house: also the whole altar that was by the oracle he overlaid with gold.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 23 And within the oracle he made two cherubims of olive tree, each ten cubits high.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 24 And five cubits was the one wing of the cherub, and five cubits the other wing of the cherub: from the uttermost part of the one wing unto the uttermost part of the other were ten cubits.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 25 And the other cherub was ten cubits: both the cherubims were of one measure and one size.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 26 The height of the one cherub was ten cubits, and so was it of the other cherub.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 27 And he set the cherubims within the inner house: and they stretched forth the wings of the cherubims, so that the wing of the one touched the one wall, and the wing of the other cherub touched the other wall; and their wings touched one another in the midst of the house.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 28 And he overlaid the cherubims with gold.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 29 And he carved all the walls of the house round about with carved figures of cherubims and palm trees and open flowers, within and without.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 30 And the floor of the house he overlaid with gold, within and without.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 31 And for the entering of the oracle he made doors of olive tree: the lintel and side posts were a fifth part of the wall.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 32 The two doors also were of olive tree; and he carved upon them carvings of cherubims and palm trees and open flowers, and overlaid them with gold, and spread gold upon the cherubims, and upon the palm trees.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 33 So also made he for the door of the temple posts of olive tree, a fourth part of the wall.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 34 And the two doors were of fir tree: the two leaves of the one door were folding, and the two leaves of the other door were folding.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 35 And he carved thereon cherubims and palm trees and open flowers: and covered them with gold fitted upon the carved work.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 36 And he built the inner court with three rows of hewed stone, and a row of cedar beams.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 37 In the fourth year was the foundation of the house of the LORD laid, in the month Zif:

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 6:
Bible.Verse: 38 And in the eleventh year, in the month Bul, which is the eighth month, was the house finished throughout all the parts thereof, and according to all the fashion of it. So was he seven years in building it.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 7:
Bible.Verse: 1 But Solomon was building his own house thirteen years, and he finished all his house.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 7:
Bible.Verse: 2 He built also the house of the forest of Lebanon; the length thereof was an hundred cubits, and the breadth thereof fifty cubits, and the height thereof thirty cubits, upon four rows of cedar pillars, with cedar beams upon the pillars.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 7:
Bible.Verse: 3 And it was covered with cedar above upon the beams, that lay on forty five pillars, fifteen in a row.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 7:
Bible.Verse: 4 And there were windows in three rows, and light was against light in three ranks.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 7:
Bible.Verse: 5 And all the doors and posts were square, with the windows: and light was against light in three ranks.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 7:
Bible.Verse: 6 And he made a porch of pillars; the length thereof was fifty cubits, and the breadth thereof thirty cubits: and the porch was before them: and the other pillars and the thick beam were before them.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 7:
Bible.Verse: 7 Then he made a porch for the throne where he might judge, even the porch of judgment: and it was covered with cedar from one side of the floor to the other.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 7:
Bible.Verse: 8 And his house where he dwelt had another court within the porch, which was of the like work. Solomon made also an house for Pharaoh's daughter, whom he had taken to wife, like unto this porch.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 7:
Bible.Verse: 9 All these were of costly stones, according to the measures of hewed stones, sawed with saws, within and without, even from the foundation unto the coping, and so on the outside toward the great court.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 7:
Bible.Verse: 10 And the foundation was of costly stones, even great stones, stones of ten cubits, and stones of eight cubits.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 7:
Bible.Verse: 11 And above were costly stones, after the measures of hewed stones, and cedars.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 7:
Bible.Verse: 12 And the great court round about was with three rows of hewed stones, and a row of cedar beams, both for the inner court of the house of the LORD, and for the porch of the house.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 7:
Bible.Verse: 13 And king Solomon sent and fetched Hiram out of Tyre.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 7:
Bible.Verse: 14 He was a widow's son of the tribe of Naphtali, and his father was a man of Tyre, a worker in brass: and he was filled with wisdom, and understanding, and cunning to work all works in brass. And he came to king Solomon, and wrought all his work.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 7:
Bible.Verse: 15 For he cast two pillars of brass, of eighteen cubits high apiece: and a line of twelve cubits did compass either of them about.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 7:
Bible.Verse: 16 And he made two chapiters of molten brass, to set upon the tops of the pillars: the height of the one chapiter was five cubits, and the height of the other chapiter was five cubits:

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 7:
Bible.Verse: 17 And nets of checker work, and wreaths of chain work, for the chapiters which were upon the top of the pillars; seven for the one chapiter, and seven for the other chapiter.

Bible.Title: 1 Kings 7:
